answers.answer: The first order of business should be to determine if you are having recurrent emboli.  Along with that you should have an assessment of your coagulation status; such as is your anticoagulation adequate, inadequate or excessive.  The nose bleeds suggest that your blood may be too "thin" and the headaches could reflect bleeding, maybe even slow leakage of blood.  Fatigue and weight loss, with a good appetite, suggests a couple of possibilities, including diabetes mellitus and an overactive thyroid gland.You should make an appointment to see your doctor, provide the information you provided here and proceed with testing to evaluate the above, which you might want to share with your doctor.
